name: sensately

in a way that relates to the ability to detect things through the senses such as feeling, sight, etc.: At this point in my life I am simply happy to be alive, sensately experiencing the world and everything around me. Although we cannot see it, we are able to sensately perceive UV as warmth on our skin.
More examplesFewer examplesDriving a car puts you in the position of receiving a lot of information rapidly and sensately and making decisions based on that information. We sensately experience the world through stimuli, including the messages delivered to us through radio and television signals.
